page.title: 20The States of Alderney
page.content: After WWII, when the island had been evacuated, a new constitution was drawn up to try and revive the island's economy and to regulate it's position with regard to Guernsey within the Bailiwick.This allowed for Alderney to be run independently by it's own States but for certain areas (such as policing) and any debts to be overseen by Guernsey.There is some disquiet about these arrangements as many would like to see more freedom to run their own affairs. The States are made up of 12 members who sit for 3 years and 4 of whom stand down every year.Their chairman is the President who is also elected for a term of 3 years.The island is run through a series of committees. One fault of the system is said to be lack of continuity.One feature of the system is the People's Meeting.
